body_html:
when you ran ./configure, did you specify 7.5 as cuda version?
Also a work-around for this kind of issue could be to find your
libcudart.so (maybe in /usr/lib/cuda) and symlink it to libcudart.so.7.0

On Tue, Aug 2, 2016 at 7:06 PM, Deepak notifications@github.com wrote:

I installed Cuda 7.5 and cudnn v4. after making the symlins and changing
the path variables, when I import tensorflow I get the error : ImportError:
libcudart.so.7.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or
directory. ?

Any advice on how to proceed?

—

body:
when you ran ./configure, did you specify 7.5 as cuda version?
Also a work-around for this kind of issue could be to find your
libcudart.so (maybe in /usr/lib/cuda) and symlink it to libcudart.so.7.0

On Tue, Aug 2, 2016 at 7:06 PM, Deepak notifications@github.com wrote:

> I installed Cuda 7.5 and cudnn v4. after making the symlins and changing
> the path variables, when I import tensorflow I get the error : ImportError:
> libcudart.so.7.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or
> directory. ?
> 
> Any advice on how to proceed?
